commit.message: do not configure default SL host (there are multiple data centers)

nodes.bodyText:
Does it make sense to refactor this complex condition to something like:
if (!configuration.dryRun() && !givenStory && notPrecodition(name) && proxyEnabled())
Does it make sense to move proxy steps to an extension?

nodes.bodyText: I propose to switch the whole story to HTTPS

nodes.bodyText: shouldn't we use the same approach for BrowserStack?
why is it shifted in right direction?
addCapabilities is a bit misleading from my pov :) maybe configureCapabilities?
should we really wrap IOE here?
can't we get rid of http and use https only since many modern web sites refuse usage of not secure protorol?
looks like this bean is not referred anywhere by its id (+ line 58)
